content.description:
Easy climbing gains the first bolt on the lip of an overlap.

Climb directly above this past two more bolts until a steep wall below the overlap is reached.

The moves up the wall to the overhang are really good.

Once the overhang is reached traverse right and then make an airy rock over move, to gain good holds above.   Make a couple of moves straight up and then traverse back left, shortly before the anchors.
content.protection: 10 bolts, Rappel Bolt and Chain anchor

content.description:
Climb up the slabby wall on nobs and dike.  The technical crux is at 2/3 height.   Continue on up the wall until a move left then back right brings you below hanging flake.

The finishing moves up and over the flake are classic.
content.protection: 8 bolts, Rappel bolt and chain anchor
content.location: Located at the right side of the crag just right of the obvious green corner of Balvenie.

content.description:
Climb straight up passing right leaning diagonal ramps.    Soon the first of two roofs will be encountered.   Make some nice moves to pass this roof and then continue up to the crux roof.

Pull the roof and then make a couple of hard moves before the anchors are reached.

The moves passed and above the 2nd roof are great.

Climb the obvious arete on the right side of the cliff.

An awkward section is encountered 3/4 of the way up the arete.  As the top is approached you need to move to the right side of the arete, before moving back to the left before the anchors.
content.protection: 7 bolts, Rappel Bolt and Chain Anchor

content.description: Climb delicately up past knobs and dikes.   A difficult sequence passed the last bolt gains the anchors.

Climb up a slab, until some delicate moves on a dike bring you to the right side of the overlap.

Make steep moves on good holds up the wall, until a good sequence allows entry into the final corner.
content.protection: 7 bolts, Rappel bolt and Chain anchor

climbs.name: If It's Not Scottish, It's Crap

content.description:
Climb up the slab until the overlap is reached.   Clip the bolt above the overlap, and then commit to the short crux.

With the crux done traverse left to the arete, and climb it, until possible to move back right to the anchors.
content.location: Located left of center on the crag.   It is the last short route before On The Rocks.

content.description: Climb straight up passing right leaning ramps.   Soon the climbing gets steeper, with a small overlap.   Continue on up passing a roof, which thankfully has nice big holds to a left facing corner to finish.
content.location: 3rd bolted line in from the right.

content.description:
Climb up a slab to the first bolt (clipped from the left).   Climb a few feet higher then start a delicate traverse right passed the 2nd and 3rd bolts.

Continue up a steepening slap to a shallow corner which leads to a steep finish.
Climb a shallow left facing corner, until tricky moves passed a quartz dike.   After this very exposed climbing follows up a stepped arete to the anchors.
content.protection: 10 bolts, Rappel Bolt and Chain anchor
content.location: Leftmost bolted line of the cliff.

content.description:
Climb the short wall (2 bolts), to gain entry to the green right facing corner.

Stem up the corner which is well protected, until a reach out right to bigger holds signals the end of the difficulties.

Continue on up easier ground to the anchors.
content.protection: 2 bolts, gear to 2", Rappel Bolt and chain anchor
content.location: Obvious green corner at the right side of the crag.
